edu.biu.protocols.yao.primitives

Class KProbeResistantMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.yao.primitives.KProbeResistantMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class KProbeResistantMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the K probe-resistant matrix that described in "Blazing Fast 2PC in the "Offline/Online Setting with Security for Malicious Adversaries" paper by Yehuda Lindell and Ben Riva, Definition 2.1.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      KProbeResistantMatrix(byte[][] matrix)
      A constructor that sets the given matrix.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getProbeResistantInputSize()
      Returns the probe resistant input size (the matrix columns).
      int[] getProbeResistantLabels()
      Returns array of size m, when each cell i contains "i".
      static KProbeResistantMatrix loadFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      Loads the matrix from a file.

      Restores the original keys using the matrix from the transformed keys.

      • transformKeys

        public byte[] transformKeys(byte[] originalKeys,
                   MultiKeyEncryptionScheme mes)
        Gets a original keys and transform them into keys that corresponds to the matrix.
        Parameters:
        originalKeys - The keys that matched the rows of the matrix.
        mes - used to generate new keys.
        Returns:
        the transformed keys, that matched the columns of the matrix.

      • transformInput

        public CircuitInput transformInput(CircuitInput originalInput,
                          java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Gets a original inputs and transform them into inputs that corresponds to the matrix columns.
        Parameters:
        originalInput - The inputs that matched the rows of the matrix.
        random - used to generate new inputs.
        Returns:
        the transformed inputs, that matched the columns of the matrix.

      • restoreKeys

        public byte[] restoreKeys(byte[] receivedKeys)
        Restores the original keys using the matrix from the transformed keys.
        Parameters:
        receivedKeys - the transformed keys.
        Returns:
        the original restored keys.

        Saves the matrix to a file.
        Parameters:
